reviewText: I love this DVD for meditation as I have tried several that were either too fast or had people leading it with very obnoxious voices. She has a stretching component during the DVD which is great as an after workout stretch or an easy day stretch. I like the backgrounds that they show and the music is soothing.  Its very hard for me to meditate as my mind wants to go 100mph on some days but this DVD helps me to calm/slow down- I'm not perfect at it but this DVD certainly helps.
summary: Great for beginners- Maritza has a soothing voice- easy to follow

reviewText: I enjoy this meditation dvd.  It's great for beginners as the yoga sequence isn't difficult at all.  I also enjoy the body scan and guided meditation with breathing.  The only problem I have is my legs falling asleep at the 15 minute mark during the meditation.

reviewText: i actually bought this for my sister because of the description of the dvd - i took a relaxation class two semesters ago and much of what we did in class (which was very helpful) sounded like what this dvd goes over.  my sister hasn't used it yet - so i can't give a detailed review...but it sounds like a great dvd for beginners.  (and if you're one of those people who thinks 'it sound too hard' or you've tried to meditate only a few times and say 'it's too hard' - it gets easier!  meditation IS hard!  at first...it takes time to learn to settle your mind...but once you keep at it and LEARN...it's the best thing EVER!)

reviewText: This is a wonderful practice! The Yoga practice is fairly short, but I love it for a morning practice. She holds the poses longer than Rodney's Yea's AM Yoga and the scenery and music are lovely. I finish it off with my own short meditation with the DVD player off. It's about a 30-minute practice (with my meditation). My spine feels so alive and I feel so centered and ready to start my day.You can wrap into the practice (or any other yoga practice) the body scan and then the seated meditation. They are both wonderful. I meditate everyday and I still love this meditation practice. Good for beginners too. Not too much talk, but just enough to get you going. Maritza voice is very soothing.This is a must have DVD! Check my other reviews for other good ones! Thank You!
summary: Wonderful! Not just for Beginners. Includes Yoga segment.

reviewText: A few things I look for when I do yoga, meditation, or other 'centering' activities:a) Does the practitioner seem competent but not overbearing or frivolous;b) Is the person's voice calm, sincere, serious, and with an absence of remarks like 'ooh..isn't this great' or intermittent bad jokes, with the idea that this makes the activity less burdensome;c) Is the routine rigorous enough so that I can feel things happening that feel as though they there is a good combination of pacing, progressive rigor (but not beyond an intermediate level of physicality)d) Does the process seem to have a logic to it in terms of a beginning, middle, and conclusion.e) Is there the right amount of guiding without a martinet-like attitudef) Is there a spiritual component, but withoug phony, alienating 'cosmic' assertions.This 70 minute program fulfills all my requirements. One can do parts 1 & 2 for a 50 minute session, or if one has more time, the full 70 minutes. There is one annoying part to the video-a long introduction before the practice beings: this is easily solved. Just practice fast-forwarding to the correct spot in the DVD/tape.  If you have a DVD/VCR combo (don't know if they still make these) get the video. I just marked in indelible ink on the transparent top of the cassette the spot where the tape should begin, after I'm done, and I'm all set for the next session. Maritza is very appealing. And don't take this in a sexist way, but if there is some spiritual version of being 'hot,' she has it. ; )
summary: I've practiced every form of yoga/mediation. This is as good as it gets.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I popped Maritza's DVD in afterAM & PM Stretch, thinking I'd do Jillian Michael'sJillian Michaels - 30 Day Shredafterward. Oh my. Why?The first part, the yoga section, is unlike other yoga routines I've done. Martiza's instruction is very inward based and her choice of words takes you to different places with the poses, changing them from a purely physical move to something more in your head. I liked it!The second part, the body imaging section--whoa. I've actually done this before, in a different style without realizing it was a type of meditation in order to help get myself to sleep. Instead, I ended up so relaxed on the floor (not asleep, quite) that I did the rest of the DVD in the same position.After the third section of the DVD, I was so relaxed I was a noodle. Seriously noodle-like. I know I hadn't fallen asleep because when I wake up, I'm never that relaxed. Clearly I have more work to do with meditation with focusing my mind.Highly recommend this DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I reviewed this before, so I'm not sure where it went.  I just put in her name to see if she had made another video.This is the best meditation video I own.  I have bought a number of video and audio tapes on meditation and I think all of them missed the boat completely---even Rodney Yee.  But I love, love, love his AM yoga.  It would be even better if the meditation section was longer and he would NOT talk.Hmmm, this is weird because I just looked through my reivews and the one I did on this DVD about a year ago is still in my list.  So I don't know why it was deleted.I also love the Plum Village meditation CD with Thich Nhat Hanh.  Excellent.

reviewText: I love Maritza's style and approach. It is so unique and rare in these days to receive what she is able to transmit, and it is amazing it holds up when you are not in a class with her but using the DVD. It's had profound effects on my life just the few days I've been meditating with this DVD and the online PM that is companion to Rodney Yee's AM. They are both excellent. I was taken aback the first time I tried her PM; it is really powerful healing and cleansing. Less angry and frustrated and snappy these days.. thanks to Maritza's wonderful meditation guidance. Can't recommend highly enough.

reviewText: I just finished watching this video, and it has really soothed my soul!I had a University midterm today, and although I think I did quite well on it, I was feeling very frazzled when I got home! I couldn't let go of the stress that I was feeling...I noticed on my video shelf, this Tape that I had bought months ago, and kept putting off trying.When I started the tape, I was a bit annoyed at how relaxed Maritza was...she was almost slurring...and closing her eyes as she talked. I was so tense that it made me even more uptight. All that ended when we got into doing the routine. The yoga was quite simple, and really helped my body to relax.Then with the guided meditations, my mind was able to relax as well.I had the best sleep after doing it!My only compalint...on my part is I wish that I had bought the DVD instead of the VHS tape because then you could just skip over the intro, and get down to working out that STRESS!You will enjoy it! But be wary...go into it with the proper frame of mind. In order to be effective, you must take your mind/body connection seriously, and be able to let go.

reviewText: This was my first meditation dvd purchase. I'll have to keep this for use at a later time. Some of the positions are a little difficult for me to do. I am a senior with back and hip issues so moving into and then sitting in some of the positions prove to be hard for me. The settings were amazing and the music is very soothing. I'll just have to save this for when I am a little more flexible.

reviewText: After doing this routine just once, I feel completely relaxed. The body scan is more powerful that you may think. The stretching in the beginning really prepares you for the meditation and releases all the tension built up during the day. Once you move to the meditation, your body is tingling from the stretches that you just did and it helps you visualize and feel different parts of the body. I love this dvd and will use it often.
